00012 //
00013 // This is a temporary workaround until the bulk of this is
00014 // available in boost config.
00015 // 23/02/03 thw
00016 //
00017 
00018 #include <boost/config.hpp> // for prior
00019 #include <boost/detail/workaround.hpp>
00020 
00021 #ifdef BOOST_ITERATOR_CONFIG_DEF
00022 # error you have nested config_def #inclusion.
00023 #else 
00024 # define BOOST_ITERATOR_CONFIG_DEF
00025 #endif 
00026 
00027 #if defined(BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION)           \
00028     || BOOST_WORKAROUND(__BORLANDC__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x531))
00029 
00030 // Recall that in general, compilers without partial specialization
00031 // can't strip constness.  Consider counting_iterator, which normally
00032 // passes a const Value to iterator_facade.  As a result, any code
00033 // which makes a std::vector of the iterator's value_type will fail
00034 // when its allocator declares functions overloaded on reference and
00035 // const_reference (the same type).
00036 //
00037 // Furthermore, Borland 5.5.1 drops constness in enough ways that we
00038 // end up using a proxy for operator[] when we otherwise shouldn't.
00039 // Using reference constness gives it an extra hint that it can
00040 // return the value_type from operator[] directly, but is not
00041 // strictly neccessary.  Not sure how best to resolve this one.
00042 
00043 # define BOOST_ITERATOR_REF_CONSTNESS_KILLS_WRITABILITY 1
00044 
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, <= 1300)                                       \
00048     || BOOST_WORKAROUND(__BORLANDC__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x531))                   \
00049     || (BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION, <= 700) && defined(_MSC_VER))
00050 # define BOOST_NO_LVALUE_RETURN_DETECTION
00051 
00052 # if 0 // test code
00053   struct v  {};
00054 
00055   typedef  char (&no)[3];
00056 
00057   template <class T>
00058   no foo(T const&, ...);
00059 
00060   template <class T>
00061   char foo(T&, int);
00062 
00063 
00064   struct value_iterator
00065   {
00066       v operator*() const;
00067   };
00068 
00069   template <class T>
00070   struct lvalue_deref_helper
00071   {
00072       static T& x;
00073       enum { value = (sizeof(foo(*x,0)) == 1) };
00074   };
00075 
00076   int z2[(lvalue_deref_helper<v*>::value == 1) ? 1 : -1];
00077   int z[(lvalue_deref_helper<value_iterator>::value) == 1 ? -1 : 1 ];
00078 # endif 
00079 
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__MWERKS__, <=0x2407)
00083 #  define BOOST_NO_IS_CONVERTIBLE // "is_convertible doesn't work for simple types"
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__GNUC__, == 2)                                                                            \
00087     || BOOST_WORKAROUND(__GNUC__, == 3) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(__GNUC_MINOR__, < 4) && !defined(__EDG_VERSION__)   \
00088     || BOOST_WORKAROUND(__BORLANDC__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x551))
00089 #  define BOOST_NO_IS_CONVERTIBLE_TEMPLATE // The following program fails to compile:
00090 
00091 #  if 0 // test code
00092     #include <boost/type_traits/is_convertible.hpp>
00093     template <class T>
00094     struct foo
00095     {
00096         foo(T);
00097 
00098         template <class U>
00099         foo(foo<U> const& other) : p(other.p) { }
00100 
00101         T p;
00102     };
00103 
00104     bool x = boost::is_convertible<foo<int const*>, foo<int*> >::value;
00105 #  endif
00106 
00107 #endif
00108 
00109 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__GNUC__, == 2 && __GNUC_MINOR__ == 95)    \
00110   || BOOST_WORKAROUND(__MWERKS__, <= 0x2407)                    \
00111   || BOOST_WORKAROUND(__BORLANDC__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x551))
00112 # define BOOST_ITERATOR_NO_MPL_AUX_HAS_XXX  // "MPL's has_xxx facility doesn't work"
00113 #endif 
00114 
00115 #if defined(BOOST_NO_SFINAE) || defined(BOOST_NO_IS_CONVERTIBLE) || defined(BOOST_NO_IS_CONVERTIBLE_TEMPLATE)
00116 # define BOOST_NO_STRICT_ITERATOR_INTEROPERABILITY
00117 #endif 
00118 
00119 # if !BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, <= 1300)
00120 #  define BOOST_ARG_DEPENDENT_TYPENAME typename
00121 # else
00122 #  define BOOST_ARG_DEPENDENT_TYPENAME
00123 # endif
00124 
00125 # if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__GNUC__, == 2) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(__GNUC_MINOR__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(95)) \
00126     || BOOST_WORKAROUND(__BORLANDC__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x564))
00127 
00128 // GCC-2.95 eagerly instantiates templated constructors and conversion
00129 // operators in convertibility checks, causing premature errors.
00130 //
00131 // Borland's problems are harder to diagnose due to lack of an
00132 // instantiation stack backtrace.  They may be due in part to the fact
00133 // that it drops cv-qualification willy-nilly in templates.
00134 #  define BOOST_NO_ONE_WAY_ITERATOR_INTEROP
00135 # endif
